column4: i have a macbook pro, i installed ubuntu on it, and used ntfstools and gparted to make a 3rd partiion on the same drive ntfs, but the mac os won't recognize that it's formated
fomate it under windows
that's not an option, i don't have an install
get a winPE?
jordan: there have been rumors that it can be coxed to write:-p  but still I could just use ntfs-3g, but it's not playing nice with my machine
winpe?
a windows livecd
interesting, but still, why would that solve the problem? what is gparted/ntfsprogs doing wrong
yeah, i'm reading up on it; i didn't know they existed
is there anyway to read an hfs+ drive with journaling on?
jordan: err, i emant read/write
挂牌

osx has hfs+, i did linux as xfs, and i planed on having a shared part. be ntfs, as i wanted to keep vm images there
if i could write to anything from both safely i would gladly use it:-\
